titleStmt.title: To the reuerend fathers in God, and our trustie and well beloued, the bishops assembled at the Conuocation. Iames. Right reuerend fathers in God, and right trustie and well beloued, we greet you well ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

notesStmt.note: Title from opening words of text.
Dated at end: VVestminster the 25. day of March, in the second yeare of our Raigne of England, Fraunce, and Ireland, and of Scotland the 37.
With bishop's covering letter to [ ] parish requiring speedy co-operation, dated at end 2. Maij. 1604.
A letter of James I directing renewed collections for the relief of Geneva. The earlier appeal was in October 1604--Cf. STC.
Identified as STC 9210 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
